etymologies: late Middle English (in the sense ‘cause to lean back’): from Old French recliner or Latin reclinare ‘bend back, recline’, from re- ‘back’ + clinare ‘to bend’

definitions: lean or lie back in a relaxed position with the back supported

examples.text: she was reclining in a deck chair

shortDefinitions: lean or lie back in relaxed position with back supported

definitions: (of a seat) be able to have the back moved into a sloping position
shortDefinitions: be able to have back moved into sloping position

definitions: move the back of (a seat) into a sloping position

examples.text: he tried to recline his seat

shortDefinitions: move back of seat into sloping position
